There were no other sightings in Cleveland on or around July 6th 2010
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting details talking on the phone and driving towards a 4way stop, nearby a mom & pop store on the corner. i looked up to see venus, brightly lit, with a few stars faint in the distance. when i looked back at the intersection, i saw what appeared to be the constellation of the big dipper, at first...but, the stars were larger and glowed with a slight orange-red tint to them. bewildered, i almost lost my breathe trying to get a better look and pulling over into the store parking lot. totally, losing my conversation on the phone..i attempted to tell them my situation and what it was i was seeing. my excitement was evident in my reaction and the told me to take a picture, so i hung up and attempted to use my cell to capture what my mind was struggling to identify. the mere size of the object was enormous, the size of a small walmart. moving from a sw to ne direction, slowly and purposely around the light pollution of nearing neighborhoods. this object first appeared as moving lights, which seemed to come into a form, and appear as a larger massive diamond\triangular shape with smooth round edges. as i sat in the car with the engine turned off and the window down, i attempted to hear some type of noise...there was nothing. i was just feeling great anxiety and astonishment at my seeing this object and not believing it was actually floating over an entire neighborhood. as it moved behind a tree line following the tracks, i had to follow in my car. still amazed, i was questioning what it was i just witnessed for the past 3 minutes. while trying to catch my breathe and sense of humor, i looked up searching again for the lights, but just as they had appeared they had vanished. leaving me with knowing i had grown up near a air base and international airports and never had i seen in real life or on tv or the internet anything remotely close to what i had just seen.
Summary: Massive triangular shape creeps by as it follows train track.
